meanings.definition: Based on personal feelings or opinions rather than facts.
meanings.sent1: Her subjectivity response showed her personal feelings about the movie.
meanings.sent2: The art exhibit was a subjectivity experience for each visitor.
meanings.sent3: His subjectivity view on pizza toppings always sparks a debate.
meanings.sent4: The subjectivity nature of art allows for diverse interpretations.
meanings.sent5: The subjectivity evaluation of beauty varies from person to person.

meanings.definition: The quality of being based on personal feelings or opinions.
meanings.sent1: The subjectivity of the review made it clear it was personal.
meanings.sent2: Subjectivity can influence decision-making in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent3: The subjectivity of his jokes always lightens the mood.
meanings.sent4: The subjectivity of art is what makes it so intriguing.
meanings.sent5: The subjectivity of the debate made it hard to reach a consensus.

meanings.sent1: She expressed her subjectivity on the matter with confidence.
meanings.sent2: The subjectivity of his argument made it hard to refute.
meanings.sent3: His subjectivity always adds a unique perspective to discussions.
meanings.sent4: The subjectivity of the story gave it a personal touch.
meanings.sent5: The subjectivity of his writing style resonated with many readers.
